title: Silicon Valley of India presents best at upcoming travel mart
text:
Silicon Valley of India presents best at upcoming travel mart Adv: 
By Anil Mathur, eTN India Correspondent | Jul 26, 2015 Adv: 
Delegates at the upcoming Pacific Asia Travel Association (PATA) Travel Mart in Bengaluru, India, from September 6 to 9 can expect to be treated to the best of culture and cuisine of the region, which has also come to be known as the “Silicon Valley of India.” 
Ms. G. Sathyavathi, Director, Department of Tourism, Karnataka, said at a recent meeting on investment in tourism, organized in Delhi by the Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce & Industry (FICCI), that the state was looking forward to the Tourism Investment Forum being held during the mart to allow international delegates to learn about the many investment opportunities in Bengaluru and the rest of Karnataka. 
Another highlight of the mart will be the Travel Technology Forum, in partnership with PhocusWright, which will allow mart delegates to further expand their knowledge on the state-of-technology startups, the latest travel innovations, and gain updates from PhocusWright on their latest research. 
J. Taneja hony, Treasurer, PATA India Chapter, told eTN that they were looking forward to the event and were confident that the delegates will have a fruitful stay at the mart and the city and will see the many attractions the southern state has to offer. 
The state has a dynamic Minister, R. V. Deshpande, who personally traveled to Cambodia last year to invite participation in Bengaluru, and had given an impressive speech, highlighting the attractions of the state. A focus on micro finance and on responsible tourism are some other relevant subjects at the mart. 
Taneja, who heads Travel Spirit International, noted that the Mart is a signature event of PATA and an Asia Pacific premier travel trade show. 
Previously, Travel Mart was held in India in Hyderabad in 2008 and in New Delhi in 2011. 
About 1,000 delegates from 60 countries are expected at the Mart.
